newone.des: After waking up in her room on Christmas Eve, high school student Ryouka Tsurumi makes a series of chilling discoveries. Her mother informs her that her mansion has been evacuated and the area placed on lockdown due to the presence of an unknown and dangerous entity named X. The only other person left in the building is Shuuhei Murosaka, Ryouka's childhood friend. To add to the horror, Ryouka learns that X can brainwash people for its gruesome goal: feeding itself of human blood to reproduce. However, Shuuhei comes to Ryouka's rescue and manages to save her from one of X's brutal attacks. As the two friends try to escape from the lockdown area, they are captured by hypnotized humans and subsequently devoured by the giant beast. But for Ryouka, the nightmare has just started: she wakes up for the second time in her room, only to find out that a different X is now threatening her life. Realizing that she is stuck in a time loop, Ryouka decides to team up with Shuuhei to find a safe future away from the threat of X.
newone.name: Lockdown Zone:Lv.X

Anieme_revies.name: Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion R2
Anieme_revies.reviw: Introduction: 7.5/10, was pretty good Main Dynamic: 9/10, the dynamic between Suzaku and Lelouch was great Side Dynamics: 8/10 were also very good—especially KallenXSuzaku and LelouchXC2 Relatnships: 9/10 were great Plot: 7/10 was good Complexity: 9.4/10 was extremely great Depth: 9.2/10 was also great Protagonist: 10/10 Lelouch is a masterpiece of a character

Anieme_revies.name: The Eminence in Shadow
Anieme_revies.reviw: YES SIRR !? FIRST THINGS FIRST IF YOU LIKE OVERPOWERED MAIN CHARACTERS this is the anime for you! on god the main character has so many IM HIM moments it makes you love the anime more  2nd thing if you have seen OverLord and are a fan !! This is an anime for you !! It s pretty much the same vibe ! The side characters are OP too Only complaint i have is that the anime kinda all over the place  and fast paced ! But that coulda been just me ! Thats really all i got to say about it fr  Just putting this because it wouldn t let me publish it with out more information and blah blah blah Art style is average Story is not unique Reviewer s Rating: 8

Anieme_revies.name: Wolf's Rain
Anieme_revies.reviw: 10/10 This anime has no flaw, and every decision was a directive masterpiece, each episode following a deep philosophical meaning reflecting ongoing issues in modern life. From the themes of survival and existentialism to the hauntingly beautiful soundtrack, Wolf s Rain is a rare piece of storytelling that blends mythology, raw emotion, and a sense of inevitable fate.

Anieme_revies.name: Your Name.
Anieme_revies.reviw: The first part of the movie is kind of a time waster, because it primarily serves as a really long and drawn out exposition focusing on a concept that if removed, wouldnt meaningfully change much of the movie. Nevertheless, the story must begin somewhere, so it gets its foot in the door with as a basic slice of life as lived by two highschoolers of different families. The additional premise to the scenerypornographic slice of life would be the body swap.

Anieme_revies.name: Magic Kaito 1412
Anieme_revies.reviw: Top recommended more people should watch this amazing anime. I enjoyed this anime a lot and i am sure you will too. Detective Conan fans should definitely watch this anime because the main character of this anime is a character who appeared in the Detective Conan anime

Anieme_revies.name: Made in Abyss: Retsujitsu no Ougonkyou
Anieme_revies.reviw: I found the first season quite boring, nothing impressive, this anime has a very strange story to the point of being complex and absurd, personally I am not very interested in that but let's say that its story is quite bad

Anieme_revies.name: Headhunted to Another World: From Salaryman to Big Four!
Anieme_revies.reviw: Here we have another attempt to turn the isekai genre around to continue exploiting the genre. We have already seen the broken characters, changing the protagonist's appearance into a creature or object and we have already seen the jobs of a restaurant, farm and seller.

Anieme_revies.name: Honey Lemon Soda
Anieme_revies.reviw: Every single shoujo high school romance troupe squeezed into one show. My first mistake was watching it in dub. The mc voice was so bad, but at least the other characters were okay BUT mc talks a lot. The mc character is bland and unlikable

Anieme_revies.name: Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-
Anieme_revies.reviw: TLDR: Must-Watch It s about problem-solving and dying all over again until that problem is eventually solved The review will be based on the whole season Final verdict 9/10

Anieme_revies.name: Solo Leveling Season 2: Arise from the Shadow
Anieme_revies.reviw: The fight scenes itself were good, but when it comes to dialogue... It's horrible. The Japanese voice acting ruined a lot, though it's understandable that they're trying to match the manhwa, but this is not it

Anieme_revies.name: Dandadan
Anieme_revies.reviw: This anime was overhyped. It had some really high points, and some really low points.Animation and art style are really good, when its serious. Most of the time is over the top attempts at humor that just irritate

Anieme_revies.name: Mononoke
Anieme_revies.reviw: Mononoke is a series that is miles better than its predecessor. The main character being from the 3rd arc of a series from 2006 called 'Ayakashi: Japanese Classic Horror', the first two arcs of that series was a bit of a let down as a less than memorable series but really amped up come Kusuriuri's story

Anieme_revies.name: Rewrite: Moon and Terra
Anieme_revies.reviw: In my Rewrite Season 1 review, I mentioned how it was a decent way for the anime to settle on an original ending that, surprisingly, still fit within the universe due to the rewrite setting. Season 2 not only explains why that ending makes sense, but in a way, it also aligns thematically with the main ending of the original Rewrite visual novel

Anieme_revies.name: Aldnoah.Zero
Anieme_revies.reviw: It's not as god awful as many say but this shit is absolutely NOT a 7.39 (the current overall MAL score) like what the hell, at best this is somewhere between a 5 and 6 overall score

Anieme_revies.name: .hack//Roots
Anieme_revies.reviw: Like other media in the franchise, .hack is divided into novels, mangas, games, animes, and practically, one complements the other, not being 100% an adaptation.With hack//Roots, the difference is that it presents a mystery and, definitely, develops this mystery, you feel as if you are also inside the game and want to go after the answers.

Anieme_revies.name: 11eyes
Anieme_revies.reviw: 11eyes is an anime that some people might like, some people will hate. It is based on a novel, and for those who are familiar with it, they know that in the games there are N possible routes and N possible endings.

Anieme_revies.name: My Deer Friend Nokotan
Anieme_revies.reviw: Well, this anime gives the feeling of something that works better in short scenes than the set of episodes itself. The first and part of the second episode are really funny, but after that the third or fourth episode was very difficult to watch.

Anieme_revies.name: Golden Kamuy
Anieme_revies.reviw: Had really high hopes for this one, with it's complex characters and intriguing premise.Instead the 3rd and 4th season just showed that the writer doesn't know what they're going with this

Anieme_revies.name: The Elusive Samurai
Anieme_revies.reviw: So this was easily one of the most beautiful anime I've ever seen. The visual effects are presented in a way which is stunning an unique, and left me constantly mesmerized. The characters and setting are all loads of fun, and you really feel a palpable sense of the stakes at play.

Anieme_revies.name: Rent-a-Girlfriend Season 2
Anieme_revies.reviw: They gave more development to Chizuru. A few days ago, I thought this was a bad thing because the show has four interesting characters. However, since she is also the main character, I can't really complain. That being said, this development felt weak to me because almost all these episodes were filler

manga_review.name: After School Mate
manga_review.reviw: Do you see that cover picture of volume 1 right there? It looks alright right? Well thats the best the art of this manga will ever look and by far The drawings look really amateurish, and it has this weird mix of modern-like manga with oldschool gigantic eyes stylization which together with not sticking to the anatomy much makes the art look really uncanny

manga_review.name: Free Life Fantasy Online: Immortal Princess
manga_review.reviw: If you start playing a new game, an immensely popular game where you can literally do anything that you could possibly think of. Except maybe illegal or morally wrong stuff which might get you banned or kicked out by the administrators. Now, imagine playing this game and have exactly everything you do movements talks whatever written down on a notepad and then have someone read it

manga_review.name: Nicola Traveling Around the Demons' World
manga_review.reviw: This manga is filled with magic. The magic of life. Just like how Nicola can turn monsters in the demon world into a being filled with love, every chapter of this manga can cure a man's soul. The demon world in which Nicola stumbles into seems bizarre to ours in comparison until you realize its actually a parallel universe with a lot in common

manga_review.name: God Sider
manga_review.reviw: Do you enjoy manga that's over the top with characters constantly pulling new attacks out of nowhere to stay alive for extensive periods of time? Do you enjoy a lot of blood and guts? Do you enjoy crazy character designs coupled with fantastic art? This may be a good pickup for you. The art is consistently very good and the action almost never stops

manga_review.name: Seaside Stranger: Harukaze no Etranger
manga_review.reviw: I do have mixed feelings about it Do i think its bad? Not really i just think it's a self indulgent work which is actually not bad i caught myself smiling while reading it at times, the thing is, i do feel it lacks direction

manga_review.name: Danjo no Yuujou wa Seiritsu suru? (Iya, Shinai!!)
manga_review.reviw: Anyways, there is almost nothing to like about this manga the drama is introduced in the worst  you could imagine. First of all you would drop this manga within 10 chapters tops because of the female lead (Inuzuka Himari) he is the type of character to be hated by all the girls and liked by all the guys for no reason other than her looks which is all she has going for her

manga_review.name: Eguchi-kun wa Minogasanai
manga_review.reviw: This manga is about appreciating the small things in life. More specifically the more subtle erotic moments in one s life. Most ecchi manga try to be as in your face as possible to the point of absolute ridiculousness. While I wont quite say this manga is realistic, it overall does feel more grounded. It features the protagonist elementary school student Eguchi-kun as he notices all the slightly erotic moments in his daily life

manga_review.name: Bakuon Rettou
manga_review.reviw: Took me two days to read all of Bakuon rettou. It was like 100+ chapters too the bum behaviour is off the charts. But nah this was a really enjoyable read it’s definitely put me on manga that’s not adapted. Its basically Tokyo revengers but good. A lot of stuff in this manga is based on real life experiences from the writer too. Haven’t seen any gang/delinquent media, despite there being so much of it, actually be able to empathise with the gang members on an emotional leve

manga_review.name: Fated to Be Loved by Villains
manga_review.img: ../images/manga review/Fated to Be Loved by Villains.jpg
manga_review.reviw: Alright, let s get this straight—if you didnt like The Eminence in Shadow, then Fated to Be Loved by Villains probably isn’t for you either. For those unfamiliar, The Eminence in Shadow is a power fantasy isekai anime featuring an insanely overpowered MC who can do anything but chooses to act cool and mysterious instead

manga_review.name: Boys on the Run
manga_review.reviw: It's hard to review the story of Boys on the Run properly because, well, there is no story. If the vague synopsis wasn't enough of a warning, let me tell you clearly: this manga isn't sure what story it wants to tell. Sure, it has consistent themes and a message it wants to transmit, but it has no idea how to do it.

manga_review.name: My Child Will Have a Different Father
manga_review.reviw: Pretty bad. The premise of a woman trying to save her unborn baby's life is appealing, albieit if you ignore her flawed methodology of choosing another father = still same baby. Her more matronly personality is a nice reflection of that, and she does fight back when armed

manga_review.name: Eromanga-sensei: Yamada Elf Daisensei no Koisuru Junshin Gohan
manga_review.reviw: This is one of the strangest concepts for a manga Ive ever seen. To clarify, by concept I don t mean premise of the manga, as those can get quite extreme, but rather what exactly this manga is trying to do. It s essentially a food spin off Eromanga-sensei.

manga_review.name: Itoko no Oneechan ni Amaechau
manga_review.reviw: you're reading this to gawk at some huge anime tiddies in the context of the inherit tension of familial taboo - this gets you some of that. The booba looks great despite the enormity and the manga finds multiple ways to show them off. Oddly, the artists may not have a grip on drawing ass - the very few shots you see of cheek reveal an unnatural looking lift with not enough thigh to offse

manga_review.name: How to Train Your Devil
manga_review.reviw: I never actually finished this manga, i actually only had the 4th copy. I got this book sent to my from family when i was at a summer camp 2 years ago. I was reading it out in the open at one point. Then this kid sees me reading it and starts screaming HE HAS HENTAI! HE HAS HENTAI and of course the page i was on was some freaky ass vine shit
